PROJ-101.summary: User login with email and password
PROJ-101.description: As a registered user, I want to log in with my email and password so that I can access my personal dashboard and existing test plans.
PROJ-101.acceptance_criteria:
- Given a registered user with a valid email and password, when they submit the login form, then they are redirected to the dashboard.
- Given an unregistered email, when the user tries to log in, then an error message is displayed and no session is created.
- Given a locked account, when the user tries to log in, then an appropriate warning message is displayed and the account remains locked.
- Login attempts must be logged for audit (user, timestamp, success/failure).

PROJ-102.description: As a user who forgot my password, I want to request a reset link so that I can set a new password and log in again.
PROJ-102.acceptance_criteria:
- Given a registered email, when the user requests a password reset, then a reset link is sent to that email.
- Given an unregistered email, when the user requests a password reset, then a generic message is displayed and no email is sent.
- Given a valid reset link, when the user sets a new password, then the old password no longer works.
- A reset link is valid for a limited time and a single use.

PROJ-201.summary: Search existing test cases by keyword and tag
PROJ-201.description: As a QA engineer, I want to search existing test cases by keyword, tag and Jira key so that I can quickly reuse or adapt tests for a new User Story.
PROJ-201.acceptance_criteria:
- Given a keyword that exists in multiple test cases, when the QA searches, then the matching tests are listed with key, summary and tags.
- Given a tag filter (e.g. 'regression' or 'security'), when applied, then only tests with the selected tag are shown.
- Given a Jira key filter, when applied, then only tests linked to that Jira key are shown.
- The search should return results within 2 seconds for a dataset of 10,000 tests.

PROJ-301.summary: Bulk import test cases from CSV
PROJ-301.description: As a QA lead, I want to bulk import test cases from a CSV file so that I can quickly onboard existing manual tests into Xray.
PROJ-301.acceptance_criteria:
- Given a valid CSV file with required columns (title, steps, expected_result, tags), when uploaded, then all valid rows are imported as test cases.
- Given a CSV with invalid rows (missing mandatory fields), when uploaded, then invalid rows are rejected and listed in an error report.
- Given a CSV larger than the allowed size, when uploaded, then the user is informed that the file is too large.
- Import operations must be logged with the number of successful and failed rows.
